Art. 4.104. 
Violence or fraud
Shares may be cancelled on the grounds of violence or fraud.
The defendant to the application for annulment may halt the progress of the application and prevent a new division by offering and providing the plaintiff with a supplement to his share of the estate, either in cash or in kind.
A co-heir who has alienated all or part of his lot is no longer entitled to bring an action for annulment on the grounds of fraud or violence, if the alienation he has made is subsequent to the discovery of the fraud or the cessation of the violence.
